thread.title: Nokia posts sharp quarterly profit fall, sees 5G accelerating

title: Nokia posts sharp quarterly profit fall, sees 5G accelerating
text:
April 26, 2018 / 5:30 AM / Updated 28 minutes ago Nokia posts falling first quarter profits Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
HELSINKI (Reuters) - Nokia on Thursday posted weaker-than-expected quarterly profits as telecom operators particularly in North America held off spending, sending sales down 9 percent, but it expressed confidence that momentum was building later in 2018. A cyclist rides past a Nokia logo during the Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, Spain February 25, 2018. REUTERS/Yves Herman
First-quarter group earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) fell 30 percent from a year ago to 239 million euros ($291 million), clearly below analystsâ€™ average forecast of 369 million euros in a Reuters poll.
Nokia, which competes with Ericsson, Huawei [HWT.UL] and ZTE, however lifted its market view, saying that for 2018 as a whole it expected its network sales to outperform the global industry, which is projected to fall 1-3 percent. Reporting by Jussi Rosendahl and Johannes Hellstrom, editing by Eric Auchard
